Class Date

java.lang.Object
  Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date
extends Object
implements Comparable<Date>

Date class. Deals with dates from 01/01/1900.

Version:
Version 2.0 - June 2004
Author:
Mick Wood

Constructor Summary
Date(int d, int m, int y)
          Constructor for objects of class Date Sets the Date fields to (d, m, y) if these form a valid date, otherwise Date defaults to 01/01/1900.
 
Method Summary
 Date addDays(int numberOfDays)
          Return the date 'numberOfDays' after this one.
 int compareTo(Date other)
           
 int daysLater(Date date)
          returns how many days later 'this' date is than parameter 'date' For example, if: d1 = new Date (31, 12, 2004), d2 = new Date (5, 6, 2005) then d2.daysLater (d1) returns 157 Will return negative number if 'date' is after 'this'.

Constructor Detail

Date

public Date(int d,
            int m,
            int y)
Constructor for objects of class Date Sets the Date fields to (d, m, y) if these form a valid date, otherwise Date defaults to 01/01/1900.

Parameters:
d - - the day part of the date (1 <= d <= 31, depending on the month and (possibly!) year).
m - - the month part of the date (1 <= m <= 12).
y - - the year part of the date (y >= 1900).
Method Detail

addDays

public Date addDays(int numberOfDays)
Return the date 'numberOfDays' after this one.

Parameters:
numberOfDays: - the number of days to be added
Returns:
a new date numberOfDays later Example: Date d1 = new Date (14, 7, 2004) Date d2 = d1.addDays (18); // d2.toString() is "01/08/2004" precondition: numberOfDays >= 0

compareTo

public int compareTo(Date other)
Specified by:
compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>

daysLater

public int daysLater(Date date)
returns how many days later 'this' date is than parameter 'date' For example, if: d1 = new Date (31, 12, 2004), d2 = new Date (5, 6, 2005) then d2.daysLater (d1) returns 157 Will return negative number if 'date' is after 'this'.

Returns:
number of days this date is later than parameter date

equals

public boolean equals(Date other)
Compares two dates for equality

Returns:
whether 'this' and 'other' parameter represent the same date

isLater

public boolean isLater(Date date)
is 'this' after/later than 'date'?

Returns:
whether this date comes after parameter date

toString

public String toString()
Returns string representation of the date

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
the date as a String, format "09/11/2002"
